delimited-azure-connection.title: Upload Data to an Avalanche Warehouse

fields.name: AVALANCHE_CONNECT_STRING
fields.label: Select Avalanche Warehouse
fields.description: List of warehouses which exist in [AWS|Microsoft Azure].

fields.name: AVALANCHE_USERNAME
fields.label: Username
fields.description: Avalanche database username used to connect to the database. The default user is dbuser.

fields.name: AVALANCHE_PASSWORD
fields.label: Password
fields.description: Connection database password used to connect to the database.

fields.name: AVALANCHE_TABLE
fields.label: Table
fields.description: Avalanche table name where data will be written to.

fields.name: OUTPUT_MODE
fields.label: Output Mode
fields.description:
Append: Inserts the records. If the table doesn't exist, it will be created.
Delete & Append: Truncates the table before inserting.
Replace: Drops & Creates the table

fields.name: AVALANCHE_DBADMIN_GROUP_ACCESS
fields.label: Provide table access in Avalanche Query Editor
fields.description: This option grants new table access to 'dbadmingrp' group.

fields.name: create_table_query_checkbox
fields.label: Specify Table Creation Query
fields.description: Specify a create table statement to use for creating the table. Make sure partitioning is specified. Table name in the statement should match the table name above.

fields.name: UPLOADED_FILES
fields.label: Azure File List
fields.description: Avalanche authenticates through Azure Active Directory to read and ingest data from an Azure Blob storage account. You need to create a service principal and provide its credentials to allow Avalanche access to the data.

fields.name: FIELD_SEPARATOR
fields.label: Field Separator
fields.description: Delimiter used in the input files to separate fields.

fields.name: RECORD_SEPARATOR
fields.label: Record Separator
fields.description: Delimiter used in the input files to separate records.

advanceMacros.name: AVALANCHE_DSN
advanceMacros.description: Name of the ODBC data source to use for connecting to Avalanche database. Specify this if you want to use a preconfigured DSN on your system instead of connect string.

advanceMacros.name: AVALANCHE_CREATE_TABLE_QUERY
advanceMacros.description: Create table statement to use for creating the table. Make sure partitioning is specified. Table name in the query should match the value of AVALANCHE_TABLE macro.

advanceMacros.name: AVALANCHE_CREATE_TABLE_OPTIONS
advanceMacros.description: Use this option when you don't want to build the whole query but just want to specify options to pass in the "with" clause of create table query. This macro is ignored if AVALANCHE_CREATE_TABLE_QUERY macro is defined. Make sure partitioning is specified.

advanceMacros.name: FIELD_SEPARATOR
advanceMacros.description: Delimiter used in the source files to separate the fields. Note that you may have to specify RECORD_SEPARATOR as well.

advanceMacros.name: RECORD_SEPARATOR
advanceMacros.description: Delimiter used in the source files to separate the data records. Note that you may have to specify FIELD_SEPARATOR as well.

advanceMacros.name: QUOTE_CHARACTERS
advanceMacros.description: character used to quote fields. for e.g. a double quote ".  use two characters if start and end quote characters are different. for e.g. []. Note that you may have to specify RECORD_SEPARATOR and FIELD_SEPARATOR macros as well.

advanceMacros.name: SAMPLE_SIZE
advanceMacros.description: Number of records to sample for building the source schema.

advanceMacros.name: OUTPUT_MODE
advanceMacros.description: What table operations need to be performed before inserting data. Following options are available. "replace": Drops/Creates table, "delete_append": Truncates table before inserting. "append": Creates table only if doesn't exist and inserts records. Default is "append".

advanceMacros.name: DEFAULT_TEXT_COL_SIZE
advanceMacros.description: Set the default size of the text columns in the table. Set it to a reasonable value based on your data to avoid truncation.

advanceMacros.name: UNICODE_CHARS
advanceMacros.description: Tells whether the data contains unicode characters. Value can be True or False. If True, nvarchar data type is used for text columns.

advanceMacros.name: SOURCE_FETCH_SIZE
advanceMacros.description: Size of data in bytes to fetch from the source file in the azure storage. Default is 15000000 (15MB).

advanceMacros.name: AVALANCHE_DBADMIN_GROUP_ACCESS
advanceMacros.description: Grant table access to "dbadmingrp" group. Only applicable when new table is created. Default is True.
